snippet: To help them, we should focus only on what they urgently require.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Martin Ruhs cites failure of United Nations' 1990 convention that set down civil, political, economic and social rights for migrants, including those living or working abroad illegally; points out news of mistreatment of such workers seems to arrive continually; calls for approach that considers the creation of shorter list of universal 'core rights' that would have a higher chance of acceptance by greater number of countries.
lead_paragraph: To help them, we should focus only on what they urgently require.
